Everyone has their own goals and doesn't ask much from you. You can be alone and independent, and people leave you alone. It's different from the South where people are more concerned. Here, no one pries into your life. You can keep your distance and the city will just move on like waves. It's a lively place. There is a pianist next door and two vocalists upstairs. There's always something going on. In a way, we have fewer apartment strangers and more friends. We help each other when we need to. I like most of my neighbors. They treat me well. I clean up after myself and they do too. I bring mail for them and they bring for me. It's nice to see them and I think they like me too. I live in a big, cold modern building, but it's people like my neighbors that make it feel like I didn't ruin my life.

I live in a typical suburban neighborhood. The houses here are well maintained. Many have homeowner association, or HOA, rules. The roads are clean and straight. Most houses are single story, but some are two story. Mailboxes are at the end of the street. Many people in the neighborhood are retired. There are some young professionals too. The city is big but feels small. There is one mall for shopping. The neighborhood has nice things like pools and walking trails. It is a safe and comfortable place to live.

I live in a small town in the Midwest, near a big city. My neighborhood is on the east side of town. It is the most poor area, with low property values. Most people here rent their homes or live in low-income houses. My neighbors are usually friendly. They smile and say hello when I walk by. Crime rates are higher here than in other parts of town, but not very high. There have been a few violent crimes in the past ten years, including shootings and a homicide. Our neighbors lost their son in a shooting outside a bar last year. Our family has not faced much crime, just a few things disappearing from our porch. My town is affected by the "opioid epidemic." Many people have died from fentanyl overdoses. There are resources to help, like addiction rehabilitation centers and Narcan training. These challenges do not stop my town from having positive things. My son’s elementary school is great. He has special needs but loves it. There is no bullying. The PTO plans events for family involvement. The school offers free breakfast and lunch to all students. No child is treated poorly because of their ability to pay. The City Council has made many improvements to the town, but they mostly happen in the center and on the west side. My family has lived here for over 16 years. It is a good place to live. People are friendly, schools are great, and there are enough shopping options to meet our needs. Our home is not worth much, but it is comfortable.

My neighborhood is full of culture. It is on a hill, with buildings with historical meaning. I live in a 7-story apartment building near an old live theater. A block down is a small arcade bar where different people go in summer evenings. There is a big park near my home, with steps around it. In winter, homeless people set up tents here. It does not snow, but it rains, and it can be cold. They set up tents close together to stay warm. They are near a family center where they can bathe and shower.

What I like about my city is not the old buildings or the architecture. I like the people. My city was once known for gang violence. People still talk about those times. Now, people work hard to keep the city clean. They care about their city and their block. They say people should not walk alone at night. I think this warning is from old times. I feel at home in my neighborhood. People offer help. They make me feel invisible sometimes, but they also give me money and tell me I am valuable.

I live in Rural America, in a small town in Michigan. Our town is surrounded by water. We have Lake Michigan and Lake Charlevoix close by. Everywhere you go, you can find a beach to swim.

My town is like a small town. Our homes are not big or the same. Some are old and some are new. Most have basements. The houses are spread out and have yards with trampolines and playsets. Some people have gardens or fences for animals. The homes look like American homes. People here are hardworking and raise families.

Our neighborhood is peaceful and safe. Kids play outside, and neighbors know each other. People wave and smile. The grass is kept green and the plants are trimmed.

Nearby, we have a sheriff's department, health department, recycling center, baseball fields, and an airport. You can walk to get ice cream or go downtown. The park is near. It's a good place to live.
